relevant_findings.neck: Supple, jugular venous pressure not elevated, no lymphadenopathy
relevant_findings.lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes, rales, or rhonchi
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 and S2, no murmurs, rubs, or gallops
relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, non-tender, non-distended, bowel sounds present, no rebound tenderness or guarding, no organomegaly
relevant_findings.extremities: Warm, well perfused, 2+ pulses, 1+ pitting edema up to mid thigh
relevant_findings.skin: Diffuse macular rash in the back, anterior neck, and lower abdomen
relevant_findings.neurological: Cranial nerves II-XII intact, sensation to light touch intact, strength not fully documented

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Same symptoms including leg swelling, worsening pain in the medial lower legs bilaterally, numbness in the bilateral feet, and inability to move his left foot.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms, including pain and weakness of bilateral lower extremities, have worsened over the past 2 weeks.
